# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a Julia function to clean the column names:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the string
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Replace any spaces and hyphens with underscores
    col = replace(col, ' ' => "_")
    col = replace(col, '-' => "_")

    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = lstrip(rstrip(col))
    
    return col
end
```

This function works by first converting the input string to lowercase. Then it replaces all spaces with underscores and hyphens with underscores, effectively cleaning the column name as per your requirements. Finally, it strips any leading or trailing whitespaces from the resulting string.
